abstract: Op-Ed article by filmmaker Joshua Oppenheimer denounces ongoing denial of Suharto regime's United States-supported 1965 massacre of half a million Indonesians; condemns unrepentant perpetrators still in power, and lauds bravery of survivors and grassroots efforts to make regime accountable; urges passage of congressional measure to acknowledge American role in atrocity as spur for Indonesia to establish truth and reconciliation commission.
lead_paragraph: The director of “The Act of Killing” argues that the Indonesian government should end its silence over the purges that killed more than 500,000 people in 1965.
